availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas E. Young (Caldwell County, Kentucky, saddler and minister)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, saddler and minister. North Carolina native. Son of Thomas Young. Married to Malinda W. Young. Father of John T. Young, James D. Young, Burris F. Young, Paulina Clay Young, Lilburn H. Young, Edwin Young, and Addison Young. Saddler in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Presbyterian minister in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 52A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 695.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 58.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 221B.
Find A Grave, "Rev Thomas Edwin Young (1813-1901)," Memorial #62473240, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62473240 (accessed May 5, 2021).
